title: Phonebill
synopsis: Design Exercise for redesigning a phone bill inspired by a dashboard design.
tagline: UX UI Application Redesign Data Visualization Phonebill Experience D3 Bootstrap
interactionhtml:
Usability Assessment

I have used T-mobile as my carrier for two years. Whenever I logged in and tried to find what was a problem of this month's bill bomb, I often feel frustrated. Phonebill is worthy to redesign. For analysing all pain points, I looked over all process end-to-end and expressed it into a user-flow diagram.

Pain Points

  • Users should find a target link -> click -> load a new page (even it takes some minutes). Too many pages!
  • Summary and details about same category of information are dispalyed in a different pages.
  • Need to be more visual. Text-based information with a lack of filters.
  • Needs a quick tool to move on the timeline for comparison.

Current user flow - my.t-mobile.com

Questions

  • What if users get a summary of information and related details at once?
  • How to avoid to load new pages and access data with consistency?
  • What is the efficient way to display information with clear navigation?

Possible Solutions

1. Informational Navigation

A Navigation includes the visualized thumbnail information (e.g. Amount Owed / Due dates / Total usages.) Also, in a narrow scope of data visualization, a part of diagrams can be a navigation to get the more detailed visualization.

2. Access all data in less clicks

Users can get all information in few clicks without loading a new page. Dynamic contents with a cross-filtering can be a solution.

Redesigned user flow - Phonebill-board

Wireframes

Responsive Wireframes
visualhtml:
Design Mockup

Iconography

UI Design

Data Visaulization / Interface
prototypehtml:
Interactive Prototype

I coded an interactive prototype to test how the cross-filtering navigation design works.
I used pure Javascript/jQuery for interactivity, Bootstrap and LESS for styling, D3.js for data visualization, Github for running and version controling.

GO TO LIVE DEMO

GET CODE

title: GoGetIt app
credit: Roles: Jess Jung (Interaction Designer/Front-end App developer), Jihyun Lee (Creative Technologist/Back-end App developer), Eozin Che (Visual Designer), Liz khoo (Product designer)
synopsis: A connected gift box with a mobile app to motivate users to reach a given fitness goal.
tagline: Internet Of Things Connected Devices bluetoothLE Motion Tracker DashBoard UI Arduino iOS/M7 Step Counter
interactionhtml:
Problems

Have you ever given up on your goal? What was the reason - lack of self-control? or lonely struggle? There are tons of fitness Apps tracking goals, but lacking motivating features. What can make you keep going?

Possible Solutions

Physical Rewards of goal-reaching

When the fitness goal is reached, the box unlocks to reveal its secret reward.

Buddy system

Social interaction behind box-giving or box-challenging gives bigger motivation.

Interaction Flow

Whiteboard wireframe
visualhtml:
I was responsible for designing and developing UI Animation and Dashboard.

Visual design by Eozin and myself

Onboarding design

Box prototype

  • Fabricated and Decorated using Laser cutting by Jess and Eozin
  • Early Prototype and Unlock machanism designed by Liz and Eozin

Fabrication & User Testing

title: Grinch Vs. Whos
credit: Roles: Jess Jung (Interaction/Visual Designer/Front-end Developer), Juyoung Park (Creative Technologist/Back-end Developer)
synopsis: A real-time web game played using cross-platform by over 130 players.
tagline: Real-time Gaming Spatial Interaction Node.js+WebSocket BigScreens HTML5Technology CSS3animation CrossPlatform
interactionhtml:
About

My teammate, Ju Young Park and I presented a Real-time Web / Large Group Gaming Experience using the world's largest video wall. Grinch Vs. Who is a 3 minute long, url-formatted web game where maximum of 130 people can log on and play simultaneously using mobile phone. The first execution was held on the high-resolution video wall, with 120 feet wide and 11 feet high, for Big Screens show, which is an interactive media show annually hosted by ITP, NYU in New York City.

Space

Challenges

How to overcome optical barriers from generic features of Big Screens?

Big Screens has unusal aspect ratio that makes audiences not be able to track all movements at once on the screens from end to end. Also there are three columns in front of the screen wall. Those had a lot of influence on designing game interaction.

How to handle a large number of simultaneous users?

It is demanding to design a system for large group interaction. It requires a clear navigation of game rules and player actions with a low latency and a well optimized server/ database system to handle a large traffic.

Solutions

A game world can break down in three stages formatted with different url in order to make a user can stick in one of screen.

Character/ motion design aims to help players identify themselves on the screen.

Storytelling and Simplifying rules is required for attracting audiences to play.
visualhtml:
Onboarding Design using CSS3 Animation (45 seconds)

Visual design
prototypehtml:
Technical Specs

  • back-end: Juyoung Park
  • front-end: Jess Jung
  • Technology: This url-based game was executed under only one server, hosted by Amazon AWS. There was no memory usage in this game. Whole game was built under pure javascript, HTML5, CSS3, and socket.io in order to improve speed quality. While the game was executed under one server, players of this game logged on to through each socket connected to the server.

Documentation

title: Serendiffiti
credit: Roles: Jess Jung (Interaction/Visual Designer), Juyoung Park (Creative Technologist)
synopsis: A collective graffiiti mobile app design using Augmented Reality Technology.
tagline: Spatial Media Augmented Reality Collective Graffiti Video Prototyping
interactionhtml:
About Space

The New Museum, designed by Tokyo-based architects Kazuyo Sejima and Ryue Nishizawa, is a seven-story, eight-level structure located at 235 Bowery at the intersection of soHo and the Lower East side in New York City. The New Museum offers one of the most arresting public spaces called “Sky Room” in Downtown Manhattan on the seventh floor of it. It is 2,000-square-foot multipurpose space for events and special programs.
the Sky Room features two walls of floor-to-ceiling glass, and the room is surrounded by panoramic vistas of the city from an outdoor terrace that runs without interruption around the eastern and southern sides of the building.

Observation

At the beginning of design processes, We spent time in the Sky Room in order to observe how people interact with this space. It gave us inspiration to seek for a new possibility of interaction involving technology and spacial media.
Audiences standing at the patio are fated to look at neighbors’ everyday life around the building. It is a unique experience but somewhat grumpy. What if audiences have an opportunity to create and enjoy a special storytelling on the top of the urban scenery?

Possible Interactive Experience

Virtual Archive of Memories

Leaving and sharing virtual footmarks which can be spatially celebrated on the Sky Room patio.
prototypehtml:
Video Prototype

We made a simple video mockup for demonstrating an interaction idea using Photoshop, Illustrator, After effect and Premiere. Also, we presented partial technical prototypes for drawing using paper.js and spacebrew and markerless AR using OpenFrameworks in class Demo.

Documentation

Technical prototype: Node.js+paper.js+spacebrew(coded by Jess)

Technical prototype: markerless AR with OpenFrameworks(coded by Ju)

title: Mindful units
synopsis: Mindful Units is a visionary model of a connected home designed for a single occupant of a small living space, such as a Micro-Unit apartment.
tagline: Connected Devices Future Of Home Micro Units Interact With Space Concept Design
interactionhtml:
About

Mindful Units is a visionary model of a connected home designed for a single occupant of a small living space, such as a Micro-Unit apartment. It aims to transform the many constraints of this lifestyle into a more positive and productive experience.

Do you live in a city alone? Is your room smaller than a subway car? The trend of single individuals living in micro-sized apartment units is quickly becoming commonplace in urban areas worldwide. It is necessary to rethink the very concept of a living space in order to adapt to the unique challenges that this lifestyle presents. To do so, Mindful Units implements physical computing and network technology in order to make a connected living space with increased mindfulness of its occupant. It assumes that connected interaction between a habitat and a dweller can improve quality of life through memorizing his or her daily habits and giving tangible guidance.

Process

Interaction Design
visualhtml: Concept Video using 3D Rendering (VectorWorks) and Motion Graphic (After Effects)
prototypehtml: Prototype & User Test

title: Chopsticking
credit: Roles: Jess Jung (Interaction Designer/ App Developer), Christina Carter (Creative Technologist), Kyungpill Yoon (Product Designer)
synopsis: A two player board game designed to test and improve one's chopsticking skills.
tagline: Game Interaction Wired Board Game Chopstick Skill sushi yumyum Arduino RFID World Maker Faire
interactionhtml:
The easiest and most fun way to teach how to use chopsticks!

Description

Chopsticking is a two player board game designed to test and improve one's chopsticking skills. While the sushi bowl spins, each player has 30 seconds to pick up as much sushi as possible while accurately holding the chopsticks.
This game aims:

1) Find a new form of physical interaction to be gamified.
2) Develop a fully working game as a set of hardware and software.

Game Interaction Design Sketch
visualhtml:
Software: A connected mobile app

A mobile app synthesizes hardware control and user feedbacks during a play time. Bluetooth LE protocol works for the communication between hardware and software.

A Project Website
prototypehtml:
Making, Testing, Iterating

Technology

  • 1st iteration:

    Hardware: Arduino Uno/PN532 RFID Breakout board/RFID Tags/Servo Motor
    Software: Processing

  • 2nd iteration:

    Hardware: Arduino Uno/PN532 RFID Breakout board/RFID Tags/Servo Motor
    Software: Node.js+spacebrew+Herokuapp

  • 3rd iteration:

    Hardware: Blemini/Arduino Uno/PN532 RFID Breakout board/RFID Tags/Servo Motor
    Software: HTML/CSS/Javascript on the Cordova mobile app development framework

Documentation

title: Happy Circuits
credit: Created by Mixed Reality Lab, Crispin Porter + Bogusky
synopsis: What if our appliances could be a bit more social?
tagline: Connected Devices Poetic Interaction Mixed Reality Invention Room For More Possibilities BluetoothLE
interactionhtml:
IDEA

Building up an emotional relationship with home appliances

What if a brand makes a future that is much more than an automated, smart home?

Electronics is not just a utility. Electronics should have its own identity and engagement with us. Happy Circuits can assess the relationship between electronics and its owner. It can reveals hidden thoughts of appliances in order to make it express for achieving a stronger link with human.
prototypehtml: Documentation

title: We Advance U
credit: Worked as a Visual Designer/ Project Manager at NYU ITP class team taught by Despina Papadopoulos
synopsis: An online interactive education and information site that aims for connecting and empowering local women in Haiti.
tagline: Visual design UI Website Redesign Information Architecture Big Team Collaboration NGO Resource-Map
interactionhtml:
Backgrounds

This project is done by a team from a class called Design for the Real World at NYU’s Interactive Telecommunications Program taught by Despina Papadopoulos and presented to stakeholders of We Advance, a non-profit organization. The class was designed to support We Advance and We Advance University, an online interactive education and information site that seeks for ways to empower Haitian Women. In Haiti, a lot of women struggle for female rights, political rights, information, and etc. Our class had a total of 10 students, and each represented a role as a designer, framework architect, video producer, information architect, and etc. I was responsible for managing an overall project and providing clean design solution covering complex information of the website.

User experience on this website

  • Providing a weekly video series, ‘Konzannou’ and relevant information out to Haitian women in an entertaining, effective, easy and dynamic way using appropriate technology.
  • Helping people inside and outside Haiti search for nearby NGOs for self-receiving resources using map on this website.
  • Offering a hotline to make local women in Haiti ask services directly from the website.
visualhtml:
Index page with video/map thumbnail sections

Clean Design of interactive NGO resource maps

Dropdown UI design for information listing

Suggested Visual Directions

Visual Design Documentation for prototyping
